name: Uncomplicated Urinary Tract Infection (UTI)
chief_complaint: It burns when I pee, and I feel like I need to go all the time

lab_results.Urinalysis: Positive for leukocyte esterase and nitrites

prognosis: Excellent with prompt treatment; symptoms typically improve within 24-48 hours of antibiotics
description: A bacterial infection of the lower urinary tract (bladder) without systemic involvement or complicating factors. Most common in sexually active young women but can occur in any age group.
